scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of one half Hollinger box of miscellaneous documents pertaining to the Civil War, 1860-1965. The collection includes primary source materials, writings about the war by several historians, documents pertaining to museums and monuments, and pamphlets and booklets about various aspects of the war.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 1: Primary Source Materials Series 2: Local Civil War History Documents Series 3: Museums and Monuments Series 4: Pamphlets and Booklets

scopecontent.p: Muster Rolls from Union regiments in Illinois and New Hampshire; a Union convalescent regiment in Virginia; and Captain George A. Foster's company E, 20th regiment of U.S. Colored Infantry; as well as notes by Shen. Valley historian John Wayland on the muster roll of a company of Confederate infantry in the Virginia Militia.
Four letters or copies giving views of soldiers.

Documents and copies, including an honorable discharge from the Union army; a pay voucher for a colored aide-de-camp in the Union army; a copy of a receipt from Adams Express Company; a letter from the Treasury Department and a pension from the Bureau of Pensioners.

did.unittitle: 2: Local Civil War History Documents 1860-1938, and und.
Records of Confederate Soldiers 1860-1928, and und.

scopecontent.p: Records of Confederate Soldiers, including lists of Confederate companies organized in Rockingham Co.; applicants for the Southern Cross of Honor; rosters of ex-Confederates in Rockingham; and a list of veterans from the Linville District.
Writings on the war by John Wayland.
Twentieth century newspaper clippings about Civil War events.
Letters to Cassie M. Lyne, copies of three of her poems, and papers and notes on her goal to get a Confederate Monument in Court Square, Harrisonburg.

did.unittitle: Civil War Centenniel Museum Documents 1961-1965, and und.

scopecontent.p: Pamphlets and Booklets, including information about Camp Chase, Ohio, an address on Abraham Lincoln by George L. Christian, a bulletin of the Virginia State Library and "Miss Rutherford's Scrapbook."
Pamphlets and Booklets: two works on the actions of a Confederate cavalryman Capt. John H. McNeill; and a booklet on Belle Boyd, a Confederate spy from Winchester.
